item.title: Swift 2.0 - throws tip
item.description: Quick Swift 2.0 throws tip: There’s been a lot of «heated» debates regarding the throws approach added to Swift 2.0 in favor of Either<T,U>. Some examples: @cocoaphony Throws types were explicitly but hand-wavily pooh-poohed in the What’s New in Swift talk :/ Tom Brow (@browgrammer) June 13, 2015 twitter.com/browgrammer/status/... Swift exceptions compose poorly. You can’t determine concrete ErrorType from a closure that throws, and can’t throw/catch asynchronously.
